intro: Xolisma latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf xolisma, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its broad, succulent leaves that help it conserve water in harsh environments. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. Xolisma latifolia is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in full sun, making it well adapted to desert conditions. Its resilience and unique morphology make it an interesting subject for botanical study in xerophytic ecosystems.
